Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bacteriocin RC714 (natural AMPs; class 2a bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis:  APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 97.7% similarity toHiracin JM79.Activity: This small, heatstable, non-lantionine-containing peptide is active against E. faecalis, E. faecium, L. monocytogenes, L. innocua, L. murrayi, L. grayi, L. paracasei, L. plantarum, Leuconostoc sp., and P. pentosaceus.
Literature Information.Author: del Campo R, Tenorio C, Jiménez-Díaz R, Rubio C, Gómez-Lus R, Baquero F, Torres C. 2001
Literature Information.Title: Bacteriocin production in vancomycin-resistant and vancomycin-susceptible Enterococcus isolates of different origins
